creator: tom@laudeman.com
text:
mod_ssl doesn't seem to be installed as part of the binary distribution. The
documentation implies that mod_ssl is present in all cases (since no cases are
discussed when mod_ssl is not present). 

It would be nice if the SSL docs, especially the How-to gave explicit
instructions on building the SSL version. Once again, the How-to just assumes
that SSL has been built.

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
Actually, the document
http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/mod/mod_ssl.html
lists "Status: Extension", which is defined as not included 
by default.  Then to find out how to include modules, you should
look at http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/install.html#configure
since this is not something specific to mod_ssl; it is done the
same way that any other apache module is built.

Thanks for using Apache.

There isn't anything in INSTALL.bindist or README.bindist to indicate which
modules are part of a standard binary install, nor how to determine which
modules are present.

The install web page doesn't mention --with-ssl=<path>, and doesn't mention that
mod_ssl probably has to be --enable-ssl=static since OpenSSL was probably built
static.

The mod_ssl page ( http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/mod/mod_ssl.html ) doesn't
cover options for ./configure. Docs for static versus shared would be nice, as
well as --with-ssl, and examples for the httpd.conf and ssl.conf files.


The types of docs I'm suggesting can be found at:
http://www.smartframeworks.com/qt-apache-ssl.html

./configure is important and deserves its own web page. It is not sufficient to
say: "The easiest way to find all of the configuration flags for Apache is to
run ./configure --help. What follows is a brief description of most of the
arguments and environment variables."

Docs for ./configure need working examples.

Cheers!
creator: tom@laudeman.com

text:
Thanks for your suggestions.  They are appreciated.

Even more appreciated would be patches to the docs to include this stuff.
creator: slive@apache.org
towerofpower@operamail.com
text:
The binary versions of Apache win32, does not contain mod_ssl and its lib  
files.  This is stated on the download page, in the d/l dir.

There are several sites on the net that have the needed files compiled and 
ready to go.

The best way to go is to get the source and compile it, with VS.NET.  The 
official build instructions are not useful in any way.

creator: rbowen@apache.org
text:
While I tend to agree that ./configure could be better documented, and
especially useful would be a list of modules and their default on/off status, a
la 1.3, that's somewhat far away from the stated "bug" in the title. In addition
to which, configure *had* picked up a good deal of documentation since this bug
was last commented on. I'm going go close it, but encourage the various
commenters to open a new bug, if they desire, requesting specific additions to
the ./configure documentation.
